post.title: Where does your ruqqus username come from?

body:
An interesting question. My username originates from a popular french dessert cake (Dacquoise) which is a cake made with layers of almond and hazelnut meringue.

Edit: Here's the recipe: https://www.tasteatlas.com/dacquoise/recipe

post.title: Where does your ruqqus username come from?

body:
_In British English, Bongo Bongo Land [..] is a pejorative term used to refer to Third World countries, particularly in Africa, or to a fictional such country._ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bongo_Bongo_Land

Godfrey Bloom's usage of such being possibly the most famous example (over here): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZXsN_F0WKfg
body_html:
In British English, Bongo Bongo Land [..] is a pejorative term used to refer to Third World countries, particularly in Africa, or to a fictional such country. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bongo_Bongo_Land

Godfrey Bloom's usage of such being possibly the most famous example (over here): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZXsN_F0WKfg

post.title: Where does your ruqqus username come from?

author.bio: The man behind the internet meme thingy named FunnyMemeSpot. I meme, that’s just what I do.
author.bio_html: The man behind the internet meme thingy named FunnyMemeSpot. I meme, that’s just what I do.

body:
I came up with #MLJFireDragon747 a long time ago, MLJ for Major League Jackass, Fire because my dad was a Firefighter before he died, Dragon because Skyrim was awesome and I needed good sounding filler, and 747 because my nothing immigrated to this country on one. 

It replaced Tafin of Gaul which is now used primarily by the oldest of my younger half siblings. 

The Hashtag just for the hell of it and is only there sometimes.
body_html:
I came up with #MLJFireDragon747 a long time ago, MLJ for Major League Jackass, Fire because my dad was a Firefighter before he died, Dragon because Skyrim was awesome and I needed good sounding filler, and 747 because my nothing immigrated to this country on one.

It replaced Tafin of Gaul which is now used primarily by the oldest of my younger half siblings.

The Hashtag just for the hell of it and is only there sometimes.

post.title: Where does your ruqqus username come from?

body:
I have 4 different names I use as 'character names' for gaming, depending on what kind of character/game it is. I've adopted 2 of these names for general internet usage. This is one of the names, which I originally used for a swordmage for D&D, first video game usage was a mesmer from Guild Wars 2. As such, this name tends to get set for swordsmen, mages, and more chaotic or "dark" characters.

I just kind of come up with the names from nothing. I rarely land on names that I like, though. As someone who loves making worlds, wish I was better at making names instead of rarely landing on a good one I need to desperately hold onto.
body_html:
I have 4 different names I use as 'character names' for gaming, depending on what kind of character/game it is. I've adopted 2 of these names for general internet usage. This is one of the names, which I originally used for a swordmage for D&D, first video game usage was a mesmer from Guild Wars 2. As such, this name tends to get set for swordsmen, mages, and more chaotic or "dark" characters.

I just kind of come up with the names from nothing. I rarely land on names that I like, though. As someone who loves making worlds, wish I was better at making names instead of rarely landing on a good one I need to desperately hold onto.

post.title: Where does your ruqqus username come from?

body: From the days of Blood and Silver, when mead twan't enoughe'r satisfyin' yer taste. Trade a bit o' the Eastern spice fer a half a sweet roll there; a bit o' meat there. A man could live off the Eastern spice fer quite-a-while. "A fortune in taste and flavor, the Eastern spice" they say 'bout it, openly smilin' an' lickin' the memories off their lips. And listen carefully dear young one; fer this is the way-o-the-world from the dawnin' to the endin', this is what happens and will happen: When a person controls the spice, they control the wantin'; when a person controls the wantin', he controls the wanters. So ya see, feller, 'twas a time o silver and blood, and Eastern spice...and there in the memories of lips and tongue, I was king.

post.title: Where does your ruqqus username come from?

body: My cousin and I were bored and trying to come up with good DJ names, since some are so odd. He came up with MC Hanger (I had this cat named M.C. that accidentally hung itself in my blinds when I was in third grade; never leave your blinds down if you have animals and don't want to be traumatized for life and develop a dark sense of humor about it), and DJ Tummy Grumbles cuz I always got those tummy rumbles. I went with the lighter one.
body_html: My cousin and I were bored and trying to come up with good DJ names, since some are so odd. He came up with MC Hanger (I had this cat named M.C. that accidentally hung itself in my blinds when I was in third grade; never leave your blinds down if you have animals and don't want to be traumatized for life and develop a dark sense of humor about it), and DJ Tummy Grumbles cuz I always got those tummy rumbles. I went with the lighter one.

post.title: Where does your ruqqus username come from?

body:
Dragon Ball Kai’s first ending song is called “Yeah! Break! Care! Break!” In Japanese, it is stretch of a play on “yabure kabure” which is roughly translates to “utter desperation”.

I decided to take that rough translation and use it for a name.
body_html:
Dragon Ball Kai’s first ending song is called “Yeah! Break! Care! Break!” In Japanese, it is stretch of a play on “yabure kabure” which is roughly translates to “utter desperation”.

I decided to take that rough translation and use it for a name.

post.title: Where does your ruqqus username come from?

body:
In the Halloween novel, Michael Myers is called "The Shape."

I've grown to appreciate the mark the Halloween movies made on horror and all of the different iterations of Michael we've had since the first film. I'm called upon by friends to explain the series to them so I jokingly called myself "The Shapist" once. It stuck.
body_html:
In the Halloween novel, Michael Myers is called "The Shape."

I've grown to appreciate the mark the Halloween movies made on horror and all of the different iterations of Michael we've had since the first film. I'm called upon by friends to explain the series to them so I jokingly called myself "The Shapist" once. It stuck.
